newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ARA bunkers dive, then rise, Mediterranean stable.
newsitem.headline: ARA bunkers dive, then rise, Mediterranean stable.

text.p: ARA bunker prices responded to a rapid fall and partial recovery of fuel oil barges in a thin market, while Mediterranean prices were stable, dealers said.
Rotterdam 380 CST fell as low as $111.50 fob in early afternoon as a flood of selling from one major sent the high sulphur barge market crashing.
The major said problems affecting the flexi-coker of its Rotterdam refinery were solved after morning difficulties and the market recovered. Late 380 CST quotes were $114/$115 fob.
Enquiries in the whole of ARA were not plentiful, although there were a few large deals for the lucky sellers.
Hamburg prices barely responded to the ARA fluctuations, staying at around $126 fob. Buyers were again deterred by the ice surcharges levied by barge operators.
Mediterranean prices were broadly steady and demand low.
A number of enquiries came in for Gibraltar, but few actual trades materialised
The weak Singapore cargo market, the result of healthy stocks and additional Kuwaiti supplies, hit the Fujairah market which dropped $6 to around $106 for 380 CST bunkers.
